intro: Psychotria macgregorii, commonly known as MacGregor's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. The plant contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their potential medicinal properties.
